hero.headline: Accenture-Anthropic Partnership Expands: Claude Code Hits $1B Run-Rate, 30,000 Developers Get Access
hero.summary: Anthropic and Accenture announced a major multi-year strategic partnership on December 9, making Accenture a premier AI partner for coding. The Accenture Anthropic Business Group will train approximately 30,000 professionals on Claude Code, which reportedly hit $1 billion in run-rate revenue just six months after its May 2025 public launch.
hero.whyItMatters: This signals enterprise AI adoption reaching a new phase. With 30,000 Accenture developers getting Claude Code access, we're seeing the largest enterprise rollout of agentic coding tools to date. The $1B run-rate figure confirms that AI coding assistants have become a core infrastructure investment, not just a developer productivity experiment.

topStories.title: OpenAI Releases GPT-5.2-Codex: Most Advanced Agentic Coding Model with Enhanced Cybersecurity
topStories.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5.2-Codex on December 18, described as their most advanced agentic coding model. It features improved long-horizon work through context compaction, stronger performance on refactors/migrations, and significantly enhanced cybersecurity capabilities. A researcher using the previous version found a React vulnerability leading to source code exposure.

topStories.title: Chatterbox: State-of-the-Art Open-Source TTS Explodes on GitHub with 640 Stars Today
topStories.summary: Resemble AI's Chatterbox TTS model is trending on GitHub with 640 stars today. The open-source text-to-speech system claims to be 'SoTA' (state-of-the-art), offering developers a high-quality alternative for voice synthesis in their applications.

topStories.title: Claude Code Comes to Slack: Delegate Coding Tasks from Chat Threads
topStories.summary: Anthropic launched Claude Code in Slack on December 8, allowing developers to delegate coding tasks directly from chat threads. Tag @Claude to spin up a complete coding session using Slack context like bug reports or feature requests. Claude analyzes messages, determines the right repository, and shares links to open PRs.

topStories.title: Massive System Prompts Collection: Cursor, Claude Code, Windsurf, and 20+ AI Tools Leaked
topStories.summary: A GitHub repository collecting system prompts from major AI coding tools hit 376 stars today. It includes full prompts from Cursor, Claude Code, Windsurf, Devin AI, Kiro, Replit, and others—offering unprecedented insight into how these tools are engineered.

trendingRepos.name: BloopAI/vibe-kanban
trendingRepos.description: Get 10X more out of Claude Code, Codex or any coding agent. A Rust-based kanban board optimized for AI-assisted development workflows.

trendingRepos.name: resemble-ai/chatterbox
trendingRepos.description: SoTA open-source TTS. High-quality text-to-speech model from Resemble AI for voice synthesis applications.

trendingRepos.name: sinelaw/fresh
trendingRepos.description: Text editor for your terminal: easy, powerful and fast. A modern terminal editor built in Rust.

trendingRepos.name: QuantConnect/Lean
trendingRepos.description: Lean Algorithmic Trading Engine by QuantConnect. Open-source trading platform supporting Python and C# for quantitative research.

trendingSkills.name: Skill Creator
trendingSkills.description: Guidance for creating effective skills and extending Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, and tool integrations.

trendingSkills.name: RPI Workflow
trendingSkills.description: Structured approach combining Research → Plan → Implement → Validate workflow with context management and artifact persistence for complex tasks.

trendingSkills.name: Best Practices Checker
trendingSkills.description: Validates code patterns against framework-specific best practices including Effect usage, React conventions, and ORM implementations.

trendingSkills.name: Security Scanner
trendingSkills.description: Identifies security vulnerabilities including input validation gaps, authentication bypasses, data exposure risks, SQL injection, XSS, and CSRF.

newMcpServers.name: arxiv-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Bridge between AI assistants and arXiv's research repository. Search papers with advanced filtering, download as markdown, and run deep research analysis prompts.

newMcpServers.name: gmail-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Gmail operations using IMAP/SMTP with app password authentication. List messages, search emails, and send messages directly from AI assistants.

newMcpServers.name: mcp-hackernews
newMcpServers.description: Access to Hacker News stories, comments, and user data with search and content retrieval. Stay current on tech discussions.

newMcpServers.name: effect-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Tools and resources for writing Effect code in TypeScript. Helps with functional programming patterns and Effect library usage.

notableHooks.name: Session Branch Isolation
notableHooks.description: Routes changes from parallel Claude Code sessions into independent Git branches. Each session commits to refs/heads/claude/<session-id> using shadow indexes, enabling true parallel development without merge conflicts.

notableHooks.name: Permission Request Handler
notableHooks.description: Programmatically allow or deny permission requests on behalf of the user. Can auto-approve safe operations or block dangerous commands with custom logic.

notableHooks.name: Session Environment Setup
notableHooks.description: Loads development context, installs dependencies, and sets environment variables when Claude Code starts. Writes to $CLAUDE_ENV_FILE for persistent env vars across the session.

tuiTools.name: yazi
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust, based on async I/O. Modern alternative to ranger with excellent performance.

tuiTools.name: k9s
tuiTools.description: Terminal interface for managing Kubernetes clusters. Navigate pods, logs, and resources with keyboard-driven efficiency.

tuiTools.name: bottom (btm)
tuiTools.description: Customizable graphical process and system activity monitor. Real-time resource visualization with beautiful graphs.

tuiTools.name: Helix
tuiTools.description: A post-modern text editor with Kakoune/Vim-like modal editing. Built-in LSP support and tree-sitter for syntax highlighting.

Syntax highlighting toggle with improved visual feedback in theme picker
Gemini 3 Flash achieving 78% SWE-bench Verified for agentic coding

Granular shell command allowlisting in policy engine

Significantly stronger cybersecurity capabilities for vulnerability detection
Agent Skills support: reusable bundles from Anthropic's open specification

notableQuotes.quote: Developers using byLLM completed tasks over three times faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code. The framework automatically generates context-aware prompts based on the meaning and structure of the program.
notableQuotes.author: TechXplore Research

notableQuotes.quote: Just prior to the GPT-5.2-Codex release, a security researcher using GPT-5.1-Codex-Max found and responsibly disclosed a vulnerability in React that could lead to source code exposure.
notableQuotes.author: OpenAI System Card

notableQuotes.quote: Strong feedback mechanisms (code compilation checks, type safety, linting) are more effective than prompt engineering for agent reliability. Across 1,500+ merged PRs, the feedback architecture reduced agent failure modes dramatically.
notableQuotes.author: Spotify Engineering

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 14 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
